page.title: 10Heather Women's Institute
page.content: Heather Women's Institute was founded in December 1966 and has maintained a membership of 25-30. Meetings are held monthly with speakers on many varied subjects, half the year in the Chapel Schoolroom and half in the Church Hall. Visits are arranged regularly to factories and places of interest. As well as being concerned with the well-being of the whole village. Members serve on the Village Hall Committee, School Governing Body and Parish Council. Support is given to National and County events, WI events and campaigns. The neglect of Beresford House, a Grade 2 listed building and a prominent feature in the village, led to correspondence and deputations to discuss the problems with the Local Authority and it has now been renovated and converted to flats.
